description: The GenitoUrinary Development Molecular Anatomy Project (GUDMAP) is a consortium of laboratories working to provide the scientific and medical community with tools to facilitate research on the GenitoUrinary (GU) tract.
name: GUDMAP

institution.description: The GenitoUrinary Development Molecular Anatomy Project (GUDMAP) is a consortium of laboratories working to provide the scientific and medical community with curated data and tools to facilitate research on the GenitoUrinary (GU) tract. The key components are: a molecular atlas of gene expression for the developing and mature organs of the human and mouse GU tract; a high resolution molecular anatomy that highlights development of the GU system; mouse strains to facilitate developmental and functional studies within the GU system; tutorials describing GU organogenesis and innervation; and access to consortium generated data, unpublished and published, via the GUDMAP data repository. The GUDMAP tools, website and database are a public resource funded by the National Institutes of Health, USA.
institution.name: GenitoUrinary Development Molecular Anatomy Project (GUDMAP) Consortium
